commit_message:
Add preload wsgi script option

This, as stated in the documentation, specifies the same wsgi script
that we use for the application to be loaded when the vhost starts.
This is then used to reduce the time that apache takes to lazy load
the vhost's resources.

Change-Id: Id7665d27654d586eb7f3c25e8a80512e2224c4a0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstacklib refs/changes/82/393782/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*preload_wsgi_script*] # (optional) If true, sets the current current WSGIScriptAlias as the # WSGIImportScript option, with the correct process-group and # application-group. This is meant to pre-load the wsgi script to reduce the # lag introduced by apache's lazy load of the vhost. # Defaults to false # $preload_wsgi_script = false, if $preload_wsgi_script { $wsgi_import_script = "${wsgi_script_dir}/${wsgi_script_file}" $wsgi_import_script_options = { "process-group" => $wsgi_process_group, "application-group" => $wsgi_application_group, } } else { $wsgi_import_script = undef $wsgi_import_script_options = undef } wsgi_import_script => $wsgi_import_script, wsgi_import_script_options => $wsgi_import_script_options,

commit_message:
Always deploy HAProxy

to simplify the undercloud deployment and make it more similar to
what's done in the overcloud, we always deploy HAProxy. subsequent
cleaning up will come after this.

Change-Id: Icf80deebe50fd99ffaa6b8529f1bfd147e9c5fbc

commit_message:
Optionally include mod auth mellon for apache

Ensures the package providng mod_auth_mellon is
installed. Sets a dependency between the module and
the base HTTPD package to avoid Orchestration problems.

Change-Id: I23bab302a4133ebba7ccfb0acfd844bd69f7e72c
Co-Authored-By: Adam Young <ayoung@redhat.com>

added_lines: if hiera('auth_mellon_enabled', false) { include apache::mod::auth_mellon }

commit_message:
Support database as backend for domain specific configurations

Change-Id: I19d0ffd96bd3fcf72680e9ef87459deae666f09e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/83/353283/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # (optional) Ensure that the domain_specific_drivers_enabled is set to true. # If we're using file-based domain configurations it eases the use of the # keystone_domain_config resource type. # Defaults to false # # [*domain_configurations_from_database*] # (optional) Enabling this configuration option allows you to manage # domain-specific configurations through the API, which are then persisted in # the backend (typically, a SQL database), rather than using configuration # files on disk.# error if it's not the case. It ensures that a directory for holding the # domain configuration is present and the associated configuration in # keystone.conf is set up right. $domain_configurations_from_database = false, if $domain_configurations_from_database { ensure_resource( 'keystone_config', 'identity/domain_configurations_from_database', {'value' => true} ) } else { validate_absolute_path($domain_config_directory) # Better than ensure resource. We don't want to conflict with any # user definition even if they don't match exactly our parameters. # The error catching mechanism in the provider will remind them if # they did something silly, like defining a file rather than a # directory. For the permission it's their choice. if (!defined(File[$domain_config_directory])) { file { $domain_config_directory: ensure => directory, owner => $keystone_user, group => $keystone_group, mode => '0750', notify => Service[$service_name], require => Anchor['keystone::install::end'], } } # Here we want the creation to fail if the user has created those # resources with different values. That means that the user # wrongly uses using_domain_config parameter. ensure_resource( 'keystone_config', 'identity/domain_config_dir', {'value' => $domain_config_directory} ) }
deleted_lines: # (optional) Eases the use of the keystone_domain_config resource type. # It ensures that a directory for holding the domain configuration is present # and the associated configuration in keystone.conf is set up right.# error if it's not the case. validate_absolute_path($domain_config_directory) # Better than ensure resource. We don't want to conflict with any # user definition even if they don't match exactly our parameters. # The error catching mechanism in the provider will remind them if # they did something silly, like defining a file rather than a # directory. For the permission it's their choice. if (!defined(File[$domain_config_directory])) { file { $domain_config_directory: ensure => directory, owner => $keystone_user, group => $keystone_group, mode => '0750', notify => Service[$service_name], require => Anchor['keystone::install::end'], } } # Here we want the creation to fail if the user has created those # resources with different values. That means that the user # wrongly uses using_domain_config parameter. ensure_resource( 'keystone_config', 'identity/domain_config_dir', {'value' => $domain_config_directory} )

commit_message:
Object prepare for credential_create

1\ add class CredentialCreateRequest and CredentialCreateRequestBody
2\ add related unit tests
3\ regist senlin.objects.requests.credentials

Change-Id: Ic491b06df8cbe0c4dae23fca5f46c773ce798fc6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/98/411098/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import copy from senlin.objects.requests import credentials from senlin.tests.unit.common import base as test_base class TestCredentialCreate(test_base.SenlinTestCase): body = { 'user': 'fake_user_id', 'project': 'fake_project_id', 'cred': { 'openstack': { 'trust': 'fake_cred' } } } def test_credential_create_request_body(self): sot = credentials.CredentialCreateRequestBody(**self.body) self.assertEqual('fake_user_id', sot.user) self.assertEqual('fake_project_id', sot.project) x_cred = { 'openstack': { 'trust': 'fake_cred' } } self.assertEqual(x_cred, sot.cred) def test_credential_create_request_body_full(self): body = copy.deepcopy(self.body) body['user'] = 'test-user' body['project'] = 'test-project' body['cred'] = { 'openstack': { 'trust': 'test-cred' } } sot = credentials.CredentialCreateRequestBody(**body) self.assertEqual('test-user', sot.user) self.assertEqual('test-project', sot.project) x_cred = { 'openstack': { 'trust': 'test-cred' } } self.assertEqual(x_cred, sot.cred) def test_credential_create_request(self): body = credentials.CredentialCreateRequestBody(**self.body) request = {'credential': body} sot = credentials.CredentialCreateRequest(**request) self.assertIsInstance(sot.credential, credentials.CredentialCreateRequestBody) self.assertEqual('fake_user_id', sot.credential.user) self.assertEqual('fake_project_id', sot.credential.project) x_cred = { 'openstack': { 'trust': 'fake_cred' } } self.assertEqual(x_cred, sot.credential.cred)

subject: Allow compute driver to load correctly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-15 05:01:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zun/commit/f09a011acdb86c5270c90fe5550a4aa7c8cfe230', 'message': "Allow compute driver to load correctly
In certain environments the load order can be confused between nova and
nova_powervm (now that nova_powervm has a nova/ source path).

This can cause boot issues where 'No module named cmd.compute' can be
thrown because the python code is looking in nova-powervm/nova for that
driver.

This change extends the declare_namespace code to allow for the other
projects to properly load.

Similar fix: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/311724/

Closes-Bug: #1650107
Change-Id: Ibb12f73a378dcc30a0483422226f57d52b53fde9
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-15 05:02:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zun/commit/3996afe882445496316d15ade8ea34675b4ca0c8', 'message': "Allow compute driver to load correctly

and zun. This can cause boot issues where 'No module named cmd.compute'
can be thrown because the python code is looking in zun/nova for that
driver.

This change extends the declare_namespace code to allow for the other
projects to properly load.

commit_message:
Allow compute driver to load correctly

In certain environments the load order can be confused between nova
and zun. This can cause boot issues where 'No module named cmd.compute'
can be thrown because the python code is looking in zun/nova for that
driver.

This change extends the declare_namespace code to allow for the other
projects to properly load.

Similar fix: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/311724/

Closes-Bug: #1650107
Change-Id: Ibb12f73a378dcc30a0483422226f57d52b53fde9

commit_message:
Use __slots__ for save memory of drivers

In default, Python uses a dict to store an object's instance attributes.
The dict wastes a lot of RAM. Python can't just allocate a static amount
of memory at object creation to store all the attributes. Here is an
example showing exact memory usage with and without __slots__ done in
IPython using ipython_memory_usage.ipython_memory_usage [1]. I use
__slots__ to tell Python not to use a dict, and only allocate space for
a fixed set of attributes is tuple instead of dict. We can probably
define __slots__ on the driver class to reduce memory.[2]

[1]http://book.pythontips.com/en/latest/__slots__magic.html
[2]https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/ironic-specs/specs/not-implemented/driver-composition-reform.html#performance-impact

Change-Id: Ic7232f46c96599313011b0c7489b09cefbe93ae5
Partial-Bug: #1524745

commit_message:
Implement only restart the container which configuration changed

In parent implement, if the glance-api container is changed (like adding
an environment), both glance-api and glance-registry will be
restarted/recreate.

In this implement, if the glance-registry will not be restart.

This implement is more optimal, but more complication, especially for
big service, like nova and neturon. no idea whether it is worth.

Change-Id: I4ad70b07dbd7c3d552cf267112fbe879e0076dfc

commit_message:
Always set all socket timeouts

When exchange/queue are declared the timeout is the default (None)
when it should be the no more than heartbeat timeout.

Also we have to set TCP_USER_TIMEOUT to ensure our timeouts are
respected. socket.settimeout() of python relies on select() that can
be blocked because kernel doesn't return during a recv() because of
TCP connection breakage.

This change fixes that by always setting TCP_USER_TIMEOUT and python
socket timeout each time the connection is establish.

Change-Id: Ibf6139ac2c22d9eeda7030fb87b7f1139d92332e

subject: Deployed server: switch to apply-config hook
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-10 12:39:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/04677b5624b8f71b753a95e13e9c0eb5e6dc9f0e', 'message': "Deployed server: switch to apply-config hook

This patch switches the deployed-server.yaml template to use
apply-config instead of os-apply-config. The 'apply-config' hook
is now installed via a package (no longer requires elements for
installation) and supports more signalling options.

This is required to support the undercloud installer which doesn't work
with os-collect-config heat metadata.

commit_message:
Deployed server: switch to apply-config hook

This patch switches the deployed-server.yaml template to use
apply-config instead of os-apply-config. The 'apply-config' hook
is now installed via a package (no longer requires elements for
installation) and supports more signalling options.

This is required to support the undercloud installer which doesn't work
with os-collect-config heat metadata.

Change-Id: I7963fe4f38e8f04c9871fe651d39efec1aa17c41

commit_message:
Use tempest instead of Tempest-lib

tempest-lib has been deprecated since a year. All
the interfaces available in tempest-lib are now available
in tempest/lib.

This patch make use of tempest/lib instead of tempest-lib.
Also add tempest in test-requirements.txt

Change-Id: Ic9865fa64c52155f0fcd3a048daa18e0003548f9

added_lines: @atomic.action_timer("senlin.cluster_scale_in") def _scale_in_cluster(self, cluster, count): """Cluster scale in. :param cluster: cluster object. :param count: number of nodes to be removed from the cluster. """ res = self.admin_clients("senlin").cluster_scale_in(cluster.id, count) action = self._get_action(res["action"]) utils.wait_for_status( action, ready_statuses=["SUCCEEDED"], failure_statuses=["FAILED"], update_resource=self._get_action, timeout=senlin_utils.CONF.benchmark.senlin_action_timeout) @validation.required_openstack(admin=True) @validation.required_services(consts.Service.SENLIN) @validation.required_contexts("profiles") @scenario.configure(context={"cleanup": ["senlin"]}) def create_scale_in_delete_cluster(self, desired_capacity=1, min_size=0, max_size=-1, count=1): """Create a cluster, scale-in it and then delete it. Measure the `senlin cluster-create`, `senlin cluster-scale-in` and `senlin cluster-delete` commands performance. :param desired_capacity: The capacity or initial number of nodes owned by the cluster :param min_size: The minimum number of nodes owned by the cluster :param max_size: The maximum number of nodes owned by the cluster. -1 means no limit :param count: The number of nodes will be removed from the cluster. """ profile_id = self.context["tenant"]["profile"] cluster = self._create_cluster(profile_id, desired_capacity, min_size, max_size) self._scale_in_cluster(cluster, count) self._delete_cluster(cluster)

commit_message:
Stop allowing tags as empty string

Nova support tagging of instance or other resource like device etc.
But those tags are allowed to be as empty string which does not make
much sense or any real use case.

Updating single tag with empty string is not possible as it will
be 404 due to url itself has single tag as id.

But updating all tags with few or all of them as empty string
does not complain. In those cases, empty tags are being accepted and
stored as same.

Main issue with those is that empty tag cannot be deleted/show as single
tag as it will again 404 with url not found. Only way to delete/show
such tag is to delete all together.

Empty tag should not be allowed at first.
This commit makes empty string request to 400 which are
currently 200. Doing for server and device tags and same can
be adopted for other resource tagging also if any in future.

Fixing this as bug fix hoping no backward incompatibility
logically. If such tag could have been deleted alone then we could have
fix this with microversion.

Change-Id: I18a81f19205b2a40ca470067a9576f2f72ff0f13
Closes-Bug: #1648663

commit_message:
Fix typo installation guide

1. What is the problem?
There were some typos in the title of installation guide that could
raises errors for documentation generator tools, e. g. sphinix.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
This change fixes the typo and format of the title and change the
plural for the environments referred in the installation guide.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution?
No new features

Change-Id: Iac7d7cbb38c2af3541b2e6b860784cb52d8da7c0

commit_message:
Wait for identity endpoint instead of sleeping

* added a small ruby block with a loop to check if the keystonen admin
  endpoint is up before trying to register projects, users etc.
* will wait 60 seconds for admin endpoint to become ready and raise
  error specific exception otherwise if Timeout::Error was raised

Change-Id: Ief678b0f40685e91ced9bddde95b916f4587b330

commit_message:
handle stable branch eol

Allow reno to handle the OpenStack process of deleting stable branches
and replacing them with eol tags.

Change-Id: I41ab682f081e7fd39ea534b7e2180c2109ca34ef
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/reno refs/changes/39/410839/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _branch_or_eol_tag(reporoot, branch): """If a stable branch is deleted, convert the name to the eol tag. """ branch_results = utils.check_output([ 'git', 'branch', '--list', '-r', ]) branches = [b.strip() for b in branch_results.splitlines()] if branch in branches: return branch return branch.rpartition('/')[-1] + '-eol' tag_cmd.append(_branch_or_eol_tag(reporoot, branch)) log_cmd.append(_branch_or_eol_tag(reporoot, branch))

commit_message:
Remove Ubuntu Trusty Support

OpenStack projects in general have stopped testing on Trusty
in Newton. The Ubuntu distribution is not implementing any
of the required distribution binaries that OpenStack depends
on for Newton and above on Trusty.

As a result of these factors, OpenStack-Ansible is dropping
Trusty support in Ocata.

Change-Id: I65801948506f5631689a6ef748dad26f13df3c12
Related-Bug: #1644349

commit_message:
Revert "Use liberty-eol tag for liberty release notes"

This reverts commit 4a237c02e43dbefb61a1b1f34b3e268593b5061a

reno 1.9.0 has a bug which doesn't handle using an -eol tag
as the branch, because it transforms it blindly into something
like liberty-eol-eol which doesn't exist.

As we're coming up on the ocata-2 milestone and need to get
some release notes in for the beta tag, we need to just
revert this change to make things work with reno 1.9.0.

Change-Id: I081e79245ccb45eaddb9b3cbe2868685628b7304
Related-Bug: #1650089

added_lines: from keystone.cmd.doctor import tokens class TokensDoctorTests(unit.TestCase): def test_unreasonable_max_token_size_raised(self): # Symptom Detected: the max_token_size for uuid is not 32 self.config_fixture.config(group='token', provider='uuid') self.config_fixture.config(max_token_size=33) self.assertTrue(tokens.symptom_unreasonable_max_token_size()) # Symptom Detected: the max_token_size for fernet is greater than 255 self.config_fixture.config(group='token', provider='fernet') self.config_fixture.config(max_token_size=256) self.assertTrue(tokens.symptom_unreasonable_max_token_size()) def test_unreasonable_max_token_size_not_raised(self): # No Symptom Detected: the max_token_size for uuid is 32 self.config_fixture.config(group='token', provider='uuid') self.config_fixture.config(max_token_size=32) self.assertFalse(tokens.symptom_unreasonable_max_token_size()) # Symptom Detected: the max_token_size for fernet is greater than 255 self.config_fixture.config(group='token', provider='fernet') self.config_fixture.config(max_token_size=255) self.assertFalse(tokens.symptom_unreasonable_max_token_size())

commit_message:
Dell SC: Unable to locate LV primary after LV-AFO

The Dell SC driver does not always locate the LV primary
after an LV-AFO event. The details in the LiveVolume object
returned by the DSM after an LV-AFO event can vary depending
on state and SCOS versions.

In the case that where the LV has failed over, the secondary
is active and no primary volume is returned in the LV object,
the driver now returns the proper LV object.

Closes-Bug: #1645506
Change-Id: I4ebcf1e1030425855bd873e5a4c2305a3519ee2e

commit_message:
Fix an error message for validate_values

This commit shows valid values as an error message when a user specified
wrong value as follows. The user will be able to understand what to set.

  * Before: hoge is not in valid_values.
  * After:  hoge is not in '['fuga', 'piyo']'.

Change-Id: I07b7640af70a6dfe28d104dcf639e195162cfbe9
Closes-Bug: #1649885

commit_message:
Show team and repository tags

The image was hidden by last commit, which attempted to fix the doc build
error. However, that error was due to a bad version of docutils [1], and
global requirements has already ignored the version [2]. So we can make
the image visible now.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/409529/
[2] https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/master/global-requirements.txt#L43
Change-Id: I02268f3f193fa0a074275171b8ef4ff6dcd4f065

subject: Fix unit tests for LVM migration with os-brick 1.7.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-07 23:50:09.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/a73296e65c433da674979db3696c80f6e051b16f', 'message': 'Fix unit tests for LVM migration with os-brick 1.7.0

Commit a9f50dd3823ea2e9c568a1fdd970e268955dca9f in os-brick 1.7.0
introduced the usage of safe_decode() of the results of CLI commands.
This revealed that two unit tests in Cinder use a mocked "execute"
method of os-brick *without* specifying the return value. This lead
to an exception in the safe_decode() method as it isn't able to
decode MagicMocks:
    TypeError: <class 'mock.mock.MagicMock'> can't be decoded

This change adds return values to the mocked "execute" method which
can be decoded safely.

This change can not be cherry picked from the newton and ocata fixes
(dc84c1de76e51487c8b7a72ba623c12ee2747879) due to refactoring of the
test_volume unit test files.

Co-Authored-By: Markus Zoeller <mzoeller@de.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I9b0a6c5be41c471d1a7782f77927ffe3b9652043
Closes-Bug: 1638861
(cherry picked from commit 753a147768be3ea9813f45c6adc414df69f50dee)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix unit tests for LVM migration with os-brick 1.7.0

Commit a9f50dd3823ea2e9c568a1fdd970e268955dca9f in os-brick 1.7.0
introduced the usage of safe_decode() of the results of CLI commands.
This revealed that two unit tests in Cinder use a mocked "execute"
method of os-brick *without* specifying the return value. This lead
to an exception in the safe_decode() method as it isn't able to
decode MagicMocks:
    TypeError: <class 'mock.mock.MagicMock'> can't be decoded

This change adds return values to the mocked "execute" method which
can be decoded safely.

This change can not be cherry picked from the newton and ocata fixes
(dc84c1de76e51487c8b7a72ba623c12ee2747879) due to refactoring of the
test_volume unit test files.

Co-Authored-By: Markus Zoeller <mzoeller@de.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I9b0a6c5be41c471d1a7782f77927ffe3b9652043
Closes-Bug: 1638861
(cherry picked from commit 753a147768be3ea9813f45c6adc414df69f50dee)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/79/394679/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mock_execute.return_value = ("mock_outs", "mock_errs") mock_execute.return_value = ("mock_outs", "mock_errs")

commit_message:
correcting variables seting in get_ovn_port_options

In get_ovn_port_options, variables "parent_name" "tag" and
"port_type" maybe set to None, this causes a ovsdb error log.

Change-Id: Ie59b4c23c376ca558cecf55a5101eff47f3cea47
Closes-Bug: #1649456
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>

deleted_lines: parent_name = None tag = None port_type = None parent_name = binding_profile.get('parent_name') tag = binding_profile.get('tag')

commit_message:
Allow neutron-fwaas to be enabled in Neutron

This patch adds optional support for neutron-fwaas. To enable,
set:

enable_neutron_fwaas: yes

Change-Id: I2d434586807d7a008d2ee1d3ef8d7dc7fab47ca7
Implements: kolla-neutron-fwaas
Depends-On: I9ca36012cff2e17ea877a775e8e1ca5837a2bcb1

commit_message:
Add commands examples for copy and delete

There are no examples for copy and delete command. For beginners,
they may not use both commands. Therefore, I add examples, then
beginners are able to understand how to use both commands.

Change-Id: Id702dc3f9ab903c1c1183c1e229dc6ebedaac0a7

commit_message:
Cascade deletes of RP aggregate associations

Currently when we delete a resource provider, the associations it has to
aggregates are not also deleted. This patch adds the deletion of all
ResourceProviderAggregate associations for that RP.

Closes-Bug: #1647697

Change-Id: I47ebd1464256f2fbc7505a5c1b3c74a4ba89ccf0

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-29 15:29:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6832ad86e679a6285bebdf45751097ad1b38cbcc', 'message': "DNM: Make resource provider objects not remotable

This is an experiment to see whether it will work or not.

The intent is for the resource provider objects to never be used
outside the placement API and for the placement HTTP API to be the
only interface to the information represented by the objects.
Therefore there is no need for the versioned objects that provide
the interface between the HTTP API and the database API to be
remotable.

This change removes the remote decorators and updates tests
accordingly. It has _not_ updated the object versions because if we
actually follow through with this, they won't matter too much.

I'm not sure if we should follow through with this or not, I'm just
trying it on for size to see how it looks and feels.

commit_message:
Make resource provider objects not remotable

The intent is for the resource provider objects to never be used
outside the placement API and for the placement HTTP API to be the
only remote interface to the information represented by the objects.
Therefore there is no need for the versioned objects that provide
the interface between the HTTP API and the database API to be
remotable.

This change removes the remotable decorators and updates tests
accordingly. The objects which have changed have had their versions
updated to provide a marker in their history to indicate that it
happened.

Change-Id: Ic2b431c8ba0af2dea4117687c7ef9477a6655bcf

commit_message:
Bumping Keystoneauth1 version to 2.16.0

Keystoneauth1 has implemented feature to pass service token along
with user token for long running processes. This will mitigate issue
with expired user token. We need to use this in nova.

Nova changes: I51eb0a8937fa39a2e5dafb1ad915e7113ea61f72

Change-Id: I788db2d8846ea1a2205f0dccda8d308fe49102ae
Implements: bp use-service-tokens

commit_message:
Add trio2o to the list of projects

The requirements in Trio2o can not be updated by the bot
yet, but the "check-requirements" job has already been added
to project-config/blob/master/zuul/layout.yaml.
So add trio2o project to projects.txt to trigger the
requirements sync. bot

Change-Id: I36cecb552b1d8129241d2c25fb4ac532de2c5ab9
Signed-off-by: joehuang <joehuang@huawei.com>

commit_message:
Do not set the mime-type for userdata

We set the mime-type to  'x-shellscript' for all
single userdata when user_data_format='SOFTWARE_CONFIG',
it's incorrect, for example, if user create a server
with a cloud-config userdata, we will set the mime-type to
'x-shellscript', then cloud-init will consume the userdata
as a shellscript and fail to execute.

This change will improve this by not setting the mime-type
and letting cloud-init figure it out from the first line
in the file.

Closes-Bug: #1643739
Change-Id: If026884a95c58bb81a0f04ab415909011b1a5414

commit_message:
Fix error when system uses /usr/bin/qemu-kvm, as in CentOS 7.2.

Got "libvirt.libvirtError" error when using "/usr/bin/qemu-kvm" on CentOS7.2.
CentOS 7.2 uses "/usr/libexec/qemu-kvm", this patch fixes it.

Change-Id: Icf2951701fddfac8e2f0641f6f555adb8a3c185b
Closes-Bug: #1649449

commit_message:
Add support when creating multiple databases with same db username

when creating mutiple databases like "designate",
"designate_pool_manager" with same db username in designate fuel plugin
 and the plugin makes use of puppet-openstaclib (::openstacklib::db::mysql)
so it will raise error:
  duplicate declaration: Mysql_user[designate@localhost] is already declared
in file /etc/puppet/modules/openstacklib/manifests/db/mysql/host_access.pp:33.

so we can try to set mysql_user as a virtual resource, and provide support for
the scenario by realizing virtual resource many times.

Change-Id: Ifc2b7c4720d2e6f79dc49cf8811378cfb24964be
Closes-Bug: #1612093

commit_message:
Support purge queue -- wsgi

A new endpoint /v2/queues/myqueue/purge is added to support purge
a queue, which accepts a POST body like:
{"resource_types": ["messages", "subscriptions"]} to allow user
purge particular resource of the queue. Test cases are added as
well.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Partially Implements: blueprint purge-queue

Change-Id: Ie82713fce7cb0db6612693cee81be8c3170d292a

commit_message:
Fix dot issue in field name

In Elasticsearch 2.0 field names cannot contain '.', so when indexing
document with property contains '.' in field name, it will fail with
error: "cannot contain '.'".

Change-Id: Idf954f7a427dd78c40bdeb8fecba71387e6c5a3d
Closes-bug: #1622343

commit_message:
Use util function in cluster API (4)

This is the last patch to make cluster API use the utility function for
request parsing and validation.

Change-Id: I280aab60192fc3cc4e8015a4b35754f4d0e75feb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/30/410130/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove useless decorator for _validate_policy

Every places calling _validate_policy have handled "context",
so the decorator of _validate_policy itself can be removed.

Change-Id: I20202a0b6aaff771d79b4b66ce6493255e6b735e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/14/410614/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Set max_size to cfg.CONF.max_nodes_per_cluster if -1.

Since we need to calculate with max_size in scaling_policy[1].
but it always get negative num in[1] when max_size = -1,
we need to set it cfg.CONF.max_nodes_per_cluster

[1] https://github.com/openstack/senlin/blob/master/senlin/policies/scaling_policy.py#L192

Change-Id: I308d6f9ce15e6655fe541775e5459abd5aa2cc31

commit_message:
Use liberty-eol tag for liberty release notes

reno doesn't currently handle missing branches so we need
to use the liberty-eol tag to fix the release note job in
the gate now that origin/stable/liberty is gone.

reno will eventually check for the -eol tag when a stable
branch isn't found in:

I41ab682f081e7fd39ea534b7e2180c2109ca34ef

Change-Id: Ie54f69f5c1f91a3781c876f035fe9ed838e11c08

commit_message:
Use liberty-eol tag for liberty release notes

reno doesn't currently handle missing branches so we need
to use the liberty-eol tag to fix the release note job in
the gate now that origin/stable/liberty is gone.

Change-Id: I33745679b6eff64922b96a38071c4f9f68a6a41d
Closes-bug: #1650081

commit_message:
Fix replication_status on InvalidReplicationTarget

When we cannot do a replication failover because the driver raises an
InvalidReplicationTarget exception we revert the replication status from
"failing-over" to its previous status.

Since we are not saving the previous status we were deciding what it was
based on the requested secondary_backend_id, which is wrong, as it
assumes we cannot failover from one secondary to another secondary.

This patch fixes this by changing the deciding factor from the
secondary_backend_id to the current backend_id in the service.

We had no failover_host manager tests, and this patch doesn't try to add
all the tests that we should have, it just adds the tests pertinent for
this patch to avoid regressions and test this specific functionality.
Missing tests should be added in another patch.

Closes-Bug: #1641715
Change-Id: I5a911278aef8060e14577099b0e03daf2039a783

commit_message:
Make ICMPResponder work for all router interfaces

To make ICMPResponder work for all router interfaces, the icmp flows
should have higher priorities then l3 flows. And there should be flows
to match icmp request from all subnets to router interface.

This patch adds the icmp flows, which are for cross subnets packets,
to L3_LOOKUP_TABLE.

Change-Id: I9f9fcf368aa61397242590b2edc1d04479811fba
Closes-Bug: #1635494
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/98/389498/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for port in router.get_ports(): if netaddr.IPAddress(port.get_ip()).version != 4: continue # Add ICMP responder from every router port to the # new router port. icmp_responder.ICMPResponder( datapath, dst_ip, mac, dst_mac=port.get_mac(), table_id=const.L3_LOOKUP_TABLE).add() # Add ICMP responder from new router port to other # router port. icmp_responder.ICMPResponder( datapath, port.get_ip(), port.get_mac(), dst_mac=mac, table_id=const.L3_LOOKUP_TABLE).add() icmp_responder.ICMPResponder( self.get_datapath(), ip, mac, table_id=const.L3_LOOKUP_TABLE).remove()

subject: Default libvirt_cpu_mode to none when using qemu
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-13 18:54:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci/commit/5c3073a61b04d5cde9968ba975cf3ce4aef48641', 'message': "Default libvirt_cpu_mode to none when using qemu

An upcoming update to qemu-kvm (2.6.0) with CentOS/RHEL 7.3 can break
existing implementations where qemu is the configured hypervisor and
'host-model' is used.
As such, ensure libvirt_cpu_mode is set to none when qemu is in use.

Worth noting that devstack has been setting 'none' [1] as well.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/1c442eebc8fe005af453bd610e750a1919a2b3ed/lib/nova_plugins/hypervisor-libvirt#L42

commit_message:
Default libvirt_cpu_mode to none when using qemu

An upcoming update to qemu-kvm (2.6.0) with CentOS/RHEL 7.3 can break
existing implementations where qemu is the configured hypervisor and
'host-model' is used.
As such, ensure libvirt_cpu_mode is set to none when qemu is in use.

Worth noting that devstack has been setting 'none' [1] as well.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/1c442eebc8fe005af453bd610e750a1919a2b3ed/lib/nova_plugins/hypervisor-libvirt#L42

Change-Id: I4a7c3ced59c46fb2582122260922813b09a3d042
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/59/410359/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: nova::compute::libvirt::libvirt_cpu_mode: none

commit_message:
Moving Reboot bashscript to python

Currently a reboot bash script file is used to call reboot and
poweroff operation. Deleting this file and moving the code to
python file using utils.execute()

Partial-Bug: #1557542

subject: Avoid printing traceback if VM is not HA_Enabled
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-14 13:32:09.000000000', 'files': ['masakari/engine/drivers/taskflow/base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/masakari/commit/53170d57c486938a275b43da789e0df88596f38a', 'message': "Avoid printing traceback if VM is not HA_Enabled

not HA_Enabled then it will gracefully exit the taskflow by
raising an exception which outputs the traceback in logs.

'taskflow.formatters.FailureFormatter' and overridden its
'format' method to avoid logging traceback of specified
exceptions in the logs.

NOTE:
Removed the '_format_failure' method as it is no longer

Closes-Bug: #1647115
Change-Id: Ida35d33de2d14cab17a3c485481cf50d67084347

commit_message:
Avoid printing traceback if VM is not HA_Enabled

While executing instance failure workflow, if instance is
not HA_Enabled then it will gracefully exit the taskflow by
raising an exception which outputs the traceback in logs.

Added a new class SpecialFormatter, inherited from
'taskflow.formatters.FailureFormatter' and overridden its
'format' method to avoid logging traceback of specified
exceptions in the logs.

NOTE:
Removed the '_format_failure' method as it is no longer
exists in taskflow.

Closes-Bug: #1647115
Change-Id: Ida35d33de2d14cab17a3c485481cf50d67084347
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/masakari refs/changes/56/410756/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from taskflow import formattersclass SpecialFormatter(formatters.FailureFormatter): # Exception is an excepted case, don't include traceback in log if fails. _NO_TRACE_EXCEPTIONS = (exception.SkipInstanceRecoveryException,) def __init__(self, engine): super(SpecialFormatter, self).__init__(engine) def format(self, fail, atom_matcher): if fail.check(*self._NO_TRACE_EXCEPTIONS) is not None: exc_info = None exc_details = '%s%s' % (os.linesep, fail.pformat(traceback=False)) return (exc_info, exc_details) else: return super(SpecialFormatter, self).format(fail, atom_matcher) log=logger, fail_formatter=SpecialFormatter(engine))
deleted_lines: #: Exception is an excepted case, don't include traceback in log if fails. _NO_TRACE_EXCEPTIONS = (exception.InvalidInput) log=logger) def _format_failure(self, fail): if fail.check(*self._NO_TRACE_EXCEPTIONS) is not None: exc_info = None exc_details = '%s%s' % (os.linesep, fail.pformat(traceback=False)) return (exc_info, exc_details) else: return super(DynamicLogListener, self)._format_failure(fail)

subject: Stop instance only if it's HA_Enabled
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-13 12:04:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/masakari/commit/74fbd10fe5cbc2ac03ff63aba5f668f8c2f8789e', 'message': "Check instance Ha_enabled or not before stopping it

Moved instance Ha_enabled check before stopping the instance.

There might be two reasons for end-user doesn't opt for VMHA because,
either they don't want HA at all, or end-user can somehow manage the
VM failures. In both cases, it is not appropriate to stop VM from masakari.
End-user's might have other tasks to do before stopping the instance, such
as remove it from the cluster, or send notification to someone...etc.

Change-Id: Id8bc934e1d5018433c6fd09c3c2334f3eead2431
Closes-Bug: #1649193
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-14 13:33:59.000000000', 'files': ['masakari/engine/drivers/taskflow/instance_failure.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/masakari/commit/6660692231b030f60000ed9e3ba0d6a843b14e04', 'message': "Stop instance only if it's HA_Enabled

Moved instance HA_Enabled check before stopping the instance.
The reason is because end user manages high availability of
instances by themselves without relying on operator provided
HA feature. If instance is not HA_Enabled then masakari-engine
shouldn't stop the instance.

Closes-Bug: #1649193
Change-Id: Id8bc934e1d5018433c6fd09c3c2334f3eead2431
"}]
commit_message:
Stop instance only if it's HA_Enabled

Moved instance HA_Enabled check before stopping the instance.
The reason is because end user manages high availability of
instances by themselves without relying on operator provided
HA feature. If instance is not HA_Enabled then masakari-engine
shouldn't stop the instance.

Closes-Bug: #1649193
Change-Id: Id8bc934e1d5018433c6fd09c3c2334f3eead2431
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/masakari refs/changes/82/410182/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If instance is not HA_Enabled then exit from the flow if not strutils.bool_from_string(instance.metadata.get( 'HA_Enabled', False), strict=True): LOG.info(_LI("Skipping recovery for instance: %s as it is " "not Ha_Enabled."), instance_uuid) raise exception.SkipInstanceRecoveryException()
deleted_lines: # If instance is not HA_Enabled then exit from the flow if not strutils.bool_from_string(instance.metadata.get( 'HA_Enabled', False), strict=True): LOG.info(_LI("Skipping recovery for instance: %s as it is " "not Ha_Enabled."), instance_uuid) raise exception.SkipInstanceRecoveryException()

commit_message:
Add ironic-staging-drivers to projects

This project already has check-requirements job specified in project-config
but was not added to this list, so there were no requirements syncs.

As it is a suit of "plugins" for ironic, its requirements are better to
be in sync with ironic's ones.

Change-Id: I65b552c2ea7311d4e9707a4b2788be18e363ad08

commit_message:
Pause diskimage builds for centos-7

Our current build of centos-7 is broken, currently still trying to
understand the failure.  Pause diskimage builds so we can roll back to
a working version.

Change-Id: I5369c39b40a4700663587039b9f06d126d1c0977
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove openstack-doc-tools.

Change-Id: I3b7f2f7a18325a9cb0e461e9bac2648c0c27bf4c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-doc-tools refs/changes/23/410423/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Plumb nat_destination through for ip_pool case

Currently, if ip_pool is provided to add_ips_to_server, nat_destination
is not passed along to the things that need it. Fix that. Also, while
in that, pass server to create_floating_ip so that the better neutron
FIP creation routine gets used.

Story: #2000820

commit_message:
Collapse base classes in test_image

Turns out we don't need a separate test class for REST and client
changes. Collapsing them means we can have mixed tests (like we already
do for testing tasks) and we can follow up with patches here to just
replace the mocks.

Change-Id: I1fd9691dea4db79fd997e231e9d46cae1885c5f7

commit_message:
Add new attributes to floating ips

There are four attributes that show up by default in devstack installs.
They come from the timestamp and standard attributes extensions, so it's
possible they may not always be present. But we can make them always be
present.

Change-Id: I1a05ef735c24600821856c6ec36df11e981b3d36

commit_message:
update reno to 1.9.0

Update the constraint file to allow the new release of reno with the fix
for stable branch end-of-life handling.

Change-Id: Ifee5b4e0dee15951a7cb49cc830b624f8bb4552c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add host check on replication actions

Current code has no check for the host field in any of the replication
endpoints (failover_host, freeze, and thaw) so a call to any of these
methods without the required host field will result in a KeyError
exception and a 500 code being returned to the caller.

This patch fixes this by returning expected 400 invalid error, just like
any other action does.

It also adds missing replication tests for contrib/services.py.

Closes-Bug: #1641714
Change-Id: Icf5b1277179dc7e40f53524233d57ea2e399755a

added_lines: import ddt@ddt.ddt def test_services_failover_host(self): url = '/v2/%s/os-services/failover_host' % fake.PROJECT_ID req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank(url) body = {'host': mock.sentinel.host, 'backend_id': mock.sentinel.backend_id} with mock.patch.object(self.controller.volume_api, 'failover_host') \ as failover_mock: res = self.controller.update(req, 'failover_host', body) failover_mock.assert_called_once_with(req.environ['cinder.context'], mock.sentinel.host, mock.sentinel.backend_id) self.assertEqual(202, res.status_code) def test_services_freeze(self): url = '/v2/%s/os-services/freeze' % fake.PROJECT_ID req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank(url) body = {'host': mock.sentinel.host} with mock.patch.object(self.controller.volume_api, 'freeze_host') \ as freeze_mock: res = self.controller.update(req, 'freeze', body) freeze_mock.assert_called_once_with(req.environ['cinder.context'], mock.sentinel.host) self.assertEqual(freeze_mock.return_value, res) def test_services_thaw(self): url = '/v2/%s/os-services/thaw' % fake.PROJECT_ID req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank(url) body = {'host': mock.sentinel.host} with mock.patch.object(self.controller.volume_api, 'thaw_host') \ as thaw_mock: res = self.controller.update(req, 'thaw', body) thaw_mock.assert_called_once_with(req.environ['cinder.context'], mock.sentinel.host) self.assertEqual(thaw_mock.return_value, res) @ddt.data('freeze', 'thaw', 'failover_host') def test_services_replication_calls_no_host(self, method): url = '/v2/%s/os-services/%s' % (fake.PROJECT_ID, method) req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank(url) self.assertRaises(exception.MissingRequired, self.controller.update, req, method, {})

added_lines: require 'spec_helper' describe 'vitrage::db::sync' do shared_examples_for 'vitrage-dbsync' do it 'runs vitrage-manage db sync' do is_expected.to contain_exec('vitrage-db-sync').with( :command => 'vitrage-manage db_sync', :user => 'vitrage', :path => '/usr/bin', :refreshonly => 'true', :try_sleep => 5, :tries => 10, :subscribe => ['Anchor[vitrage::install::end]', 'Anchor[vitrage::config::end]', 'Anchor[vitrage::dbsync::begin]'], :notify => 'Anchor[vitrage::dbsync::end]', ) end describe "overriding extra_params" do let :params do { :extra_params => '--config-file /etc/vitrage/vitrage.conf', } end it { is_expected.to contain_exec('vitrage-db-sync').with( :command => 'vitrage-manage db_sync --config-file /etc/vitrage/vitrage.conf', :user => 'vitrage', :path => '/usr/bin', :refreshonly => 'true', :try_sleep => 5, :tries => 10, :subscribe => ['Anchor[vitrage::install::end]', 'Anchor[vitrage::config::end]', 'Anchor[vitrage::dbsync::begin]'], :notify => 'Anchor[vitrage::dbsync::end]', ) } end end on_supported_os({ :supported_os => OSDefaults.get_supported_os }).each do |os,facts| context "on #{os}" do let (:facts) do facts.merge(OSDefaults.get_facts({ :os_workers => 8, :concat_basedir => '/var/lib/puppet/concat' })) end it_configures 'vitrage-dbsync' end end end
